p: 5. Etymology of “phenomenology.” Division of this section. “Phenomeno-logy” = ϕαινόμενον + λόγος—but this is not to be taken superficially as “the science of phenomena.” We will examine each Greek word individually [in § 7 A and B below] and then combine them [in § 7 C]. The history of the word itself (presumably from the school of Christian Wolff [1679-1754]) is not important here.
